intro: Luteola glauca, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a bluish-green hue, while the flowers are small and yellowish. Luteola glauca is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of soil conditions.
